changes.original: Adverse events will be collected voluntarily by subjects using a monthly web form.
changes.replacement: Adverse events will be collected voluntarily by subjects using a monthly web form. Investigators will promptly review and follow up on all reported adverse events, including serious adverse events and deaths.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1 & 2: Ensures prompt review of all safety information and follow-up on serious adverse events from clinical investigations

changes.replacement: Investigators are required to review all safety data from clinical investigations and promptly report serious adverse events and deaths to the sponsor.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1 & 2: Explicitly states investigator responsibility to review safety data and report serious events, addressing both violations

changes.original: No IRB or ethics committee re
changes.replacement: IRB review and approval will be obtained prior to initiating the study. The IRB will document findings for any approved alterations to informed consent requirements.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1: Adds required IRB review and documentation of findings for alterations to informed consent, addressing the regulatory requirement

changes.original: Data will be retained for at least
changes.replacement: Data will be retained for at least 2 years after marketing application approval, or if the application is not approved, for 2 years after discontinuing investigational use.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1 & 2: Specifies the required 2-year retention period for both scenarios (approval and non-approval) to comply with regulations

changes.after: Sites may implement their own recordkeeping systems.
changes.content: However, all sites must adhere to the minimum data retention requirements as specified in the protocol.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1 & 2: Reinforces compliance with retention requirements across all sites

changes.original: The IND will be filed post-study if data appear promising.
changes.replacement: An IND application will be submitted to the FDA before initiating the clinical investigation, containing sufficient information to assess subject risks.
changes.reason: VIOLATIONS 1 & 2: IND must be submitted before study start with sufficient information to assess risks, not post-study

changes.text: No Form 1572 will be collected from investigators.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1: Removing statement that contradicts proper IND submission process

changes.original: Serious adverse events will be summarized in the annual report only, and not reported within the 15-day window specified in 21 CFR 312.32.
changes.replacement: Serious unexpected adverse events with suspected drug causation will be reported within the 15-day window specified in 21 CFR 312.32, in addition to being summarized in the annual report.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1: Corrects the protocol to comply with the requirement to report serious unexpected adverse events within 15 days, even if they are part of the study endpoint.

changes.original: The sponsor may delegate all regulatory responsibilities to local CROs without documentation.
changes.replacement: The sponsor may delegate some regulatory responsibilities to local CROs with proper documentation, but must retain oversight and verify physician compliance with investigator regulations.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1: Sponsors must maintain oversight and verify physician compliance with regulations, even when delegating tasks to CROs.

changes.original: Participants will be informed verbally that their participation is optional. No written consent will be required.
changes.replacement: Participants will be provided written information about the trial and asked to sign a written informed consent form before participation. The consent form will explain that participation is optional.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1 & 2: Requires written informed consent and written explanation of trial information

changes.content: Written information will be provided to subjects including all required trial details as specified by regulations.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 3: Requires providing written information with specified trial details

changes.text: No IRB or ethics committee re
changes.reason: Incomplete sentence that may imply lack of ethics oversight. Full ethics review details should be added.

changes.original: No copies of consent forms will be retained.
changes.replacement: Copies of consent forms will be retained for the required retention period.
changes.reason: VIOLATIONS 1-4: Retaining consent forms is necessary to comply with record-keeping requirements for clinical trials

changes.after: Copies of consent forms will be retained for the required retention period.
changes.content: All clinical trial records will be maintained in accordance with applicable regulations.
changes.reason: VIOLATIONS 1-4: Explicitly stating compliance with record retention requirements

changes.after: All clinical trial records will be maintained in accordance with applicable regulations.
changes.content: The sponsor-investigator will retain these records for the specified time periods as required by law.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 4: Addressing the specific requirement for sponsor-investigators to retain records for specified time periods

changes.original: No Form 1572 will be collected from investigators.
changes.replacement: Form 1572 will be collected from investigators and submitted to the head of the medical institution for approval.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1: Ensures required documents are submitted for approval

changes.content: igator brochure will be provided. An investigator brochure containing written information for the clinical trial will be prepared and distributed to investigators.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 2: Ensures written information is prepared for the clinical trial

changes.original: The IND will be filed post-study if data appear promising.
changes.replacement: The IND, including the protocol and any amendments, will be submitted to the medical institution head prior to study initiation.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 3: Ensures protocol is submitted to medical institution head before study starts

changes.original: The sponsor may delegate all regulatory responsibilities to local CROs without documentation.
changes.replacement: The sponsor may delegate regulatory responsibilities to local CROs, but must maintain a contract stating the sponsor's right to verify compliance with instructions.
changes.reason: VIOLATION 1: Ensures compliance with the requirement for a contract stating the sponsor's right to verify compliance when delegating responsibilities
